title: refactor(SocketBuf): define SOCKETBUF_MAX_LINE_LENGTH constant
body:
## Issue: Missing constant definition for SOCKETBUF_MAX_LINE_LENGTH

**File**: \`src/socket/SocketBuf.c\`  
**Line**: 741  
**Severity**: MEDIUM  
**Category**: Redundancy  
**Pattern ID**: MAGIC_BUFFER_8192

### Description

The constant \`SOCKETBUF_MAX_LINE_LENGTH\` is used in SocketBuf.c but never defined, appearing as a magic identifier. This violates the codebase's anti-pattern guidelines against magic numbers.

### Current Code
\`\`\`c
// Line 741-743
char temp[SOCKETBUF_MAX_LINE_LENGTH + 1];
if (total_to_read > SOCKETBUF_MAX_LINE_LENGTH)
  total_to_read = SOCKETBUF_MAX_LINE_LENGTH;
\`\`\`

### Recommendation

Define the constant in \`include/socket/SocketBuf.h\` or \`include/core/SocketConfig.h\`:

\`\`\`c
/** Maximum line length for SocketBuf_readline() */
#define SOCKETBUF_MAX_LINE_LENGTH 8192
\`\`\`

### Impact

- **Code maintainability**: Makes the buffer size limit explicit and modifiable
- **Documentation**: Self-documents the maximum line length constraint
- **Consistency**: Follows codebase pattern of defining all magic numbers

### References

- CLAUDE.md Section: "C Anti-Patterns and Fixes - Magic Numbers"
- Related file: \`src/socket/SocketBuf.c\`
